intro: Galium cinereum var. tenuifolium, commonly known as slenderleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal remedies for their purported medicinal properties.
